result.execSummary:
The defendant Devale L Carpenter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: 14CF419

8:36 Defendant Devale L Carpenter in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kuhl informs court that Jasmine Cisca requests to have the no contact lifted.  Jasmine Cisca makes a statement regarding her request to lift the no contact.  State strongly opposes the modification to the bond.  Court denies the motion to lift the no contact.  Atty Kuhl moves the court to withdraw as counsel and believes the public defenders office will appoint new counsel.  Court grants the motion to withdraw as counsel and orders that he contact the public defenders officer.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Devale L Carpenter in court with attorney Shari L Post.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Devale L Carpenter in court with attorney Shari L Post.  Defendant Devale L Carpenter in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Thoms Buerger is sworn and questioned by Attorney Grode. Testifies to responding to a complaint of an individual being struck.  Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom.  Witness testifies to the incident  outlined in Case No. 14CF419 and identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
